string.text: Modernized round with improved armor-piercing characteristics due to higher muzzle velocity and use of special alloys. It is produced by state order for special forces.
Superhighspeed 9x19 caliber round. Improved expansive bullet, and armor-piercing core.

Technological round for automatic rifles of Warsaw Pact countries. Due to the use of special alloy during forging of bullet the ballistic characteristics have been improved, which affects the flatness and the penetration of the metal-containing materials.

Specialized round for automatic rifles of Warsaw Pact countries. Due to the use of cermet in the bullets manufacturing, the ballistic characteristics have been significantly improved, which affects the flatness and the penetration of the metal-containing materials. It is produced by state order for submachine guns of AK and AN-94 series for the special forces.

Specialized expansive round. The bullet has a cermet core, has high accuracy and a piercing potential. This ammo is not widespread due to the complexity of manufacturing and the high cost of production.
Superhighspeed bullet. Increased speed of the bullet flight, which had a positive impact on accuracy.

Specially designed 7,62 mm caliber sniper round. The bullet has a cermet core. In comparison with a standard round of the same caliber has improved ballistic characteristics and higher piercing ability. This ammo is not widespread due to the complexity of manufacturing and the high cost of production.
A sniper round. Has a subsonic speed, but due to a special design heavy bullet, penetrates most bulletproof vests at ranges of up to 400 meters.
Bullet-dart. Feathering stabilizes the bullet, which increases the accuracy of the firing. Massive steel body of the bullet can pierce any bulletproof vest.
Contents:\n%c[255,238,153,26]• %c[default]VOG-25 grenades\nWooden box with 10 VOG-25 grenades for an underbarrel grenade launcher.
Contents:\n%c[255,238,153,26]• %c[default]M203 grenades\nWooden box with 10 M203 grenades for an underbarrel grenade launcher.
NATO standard 7.62x51 mm caliber rifle round. Ordinary all-metal bullet.
NATO standard 7.62x51 mm caliber rifle round. A bullet with steel core, that improves armor-piercing characteristics.
PG-2V rocket propelled grenade for the RPG-7 grenade launcher.
Standard pistol round for the TT-33 pistol and the PPSh-41 submachine gun. Has an ordinary core, and a jacketed bullet.
The 12.7x99 mm round (12,7 x99 mm NATO, .50 BMG) was produced in the 1920s as ammunition for the Browning M2 heavy machine gun. It is now also used for rifles, such as Barrett M82.
The container with flammable liquid for hand flamethrower.

Cassette with 9 mm bursting charges. Originally intended for 9x39 caliber weapons, but the local craftsmen have adapted them for their shotguns as well.\n Source of explosive energy is encapsulated fragment of the "Carousel" artifact. Mercenaries found this out somehow, and forced a local craftsman to make a batch of charges for 7.62x51 mm caliber Swedish Arctic Warfare L96A1 rifles.
